Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior reserved; exterior, from top: black-figure frieze with part of possible sphinx to left (left foreleg, lower belly, haunch and paw remaining; trace of added red on underbelly) and rising rosette with red centre as filling ornament; hook maeander band between pairs of bands; chain of lotus flowers and buds above two dilute bands and remains of square and billet pattern.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 310, no. 1289)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2071) (phase 2)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. VII, no. 5)
